snippet: The case revives a scandal after a Japanese court issued modest fines and suspended sentences for several of the company’s executives.
abstract: British authorities plan to prosecute Olympus, Japanese manufacturer that was embroiled in $1.7 billion accounting fraud in 2011; move revives scandal after Japanese court imposed modest fines and suspended sentences on several executives.

byline.contributor: Mark Scott contributed reporting from London.

lead_paragraph: The case revives a scandal after a Japanese court issued modest fines and suspended sentences for several of the company’s executives.

headline.main: Britain to Prosecute Japan’s Olympus for Fraud
headline.print_headline: Britain to Prosecute Japan’s Olympus for Fraud
